Name: Shiva Sharma
Heading: MNIT Jaipur
Review:
The course is very much satisfying and the faculty members are fine. 
They are well wishers for the students and they also help them in many other activities.
I choose the course because I want to go into the highway sector.
the faculty-student ratio is  1:12.
There are 2 exams in a period of 6 months ( semester) Mid-term and End term. The mid-term exam contains less syllabus so it is easy to score there while the end-term exams are relatively tough and lengthy.

Name: Ritesh
Heading: Dtu in crisp.
Review:
Campus Life if overall is very good in comparison to other universities.
There are different societies for different purposes like cultural societies like madhurima, pratibimbh,kalakriti etc and various tech societies 
The annual fest of dtu is  Engifest which is usually held in the month of Jan-Feb every year.
Talking about no. of books in the library you will get 5-10 types of books on each topic written by different authors and publishers and even dtu has an online library which contains almost 450,000 e-books.
Aminities:-Every classrooms have enough space to hold the sitting of 70-80 students at a time and also has some large rooms too whose capacity is to accommodate even 120-150 students.
Every classroom has a projection system too.
Sports and extracurricular activities are somewhat nice and compulsory too if you opt for sports in electives and even you can play on your own because sports facilities are soo good in dtu.
There are different societies which are fully run by students only.

Name: Leonard George
Heading: Atharva College
Review:
I took this course because I had already taken into consideration that I wanted to join the IT sector as my parents work and they taught me well about it.
The Faculty to Student ratio is 40 and it was a very good experience to study in different labs all the teachers had excellent skills regarding their particular subject and were always ready to help you out solving the doubts and errors that occurred.
Teachers are helpful, highly qualified, well-versed, and generous. They used a better method of teaching that was easily understood by us. Even lab assistants are helpful and provide the best instruments to perform.
Exams were Held in December that is the First semester of the respective Year and The other one was in May and that is the second semester of the respective Year between them were Term tests that occurred between 2 months after starting a New semester, It was not difficult to pass as we were taught about everything that was to appear in the exam

College: University College of Engineering Narasaraopet, JNTUK
Heading: Worthy faculty a student should require
Review:

About 80% of the students get placement in a reputed company.

The teaching method is great if you study with just a little focus you will understand everything. 
Terms exams every 3 months and difficulty is moderate.

Name: Ashutosh Prasad swain
Heading: Reality check: Hi-tech medical college and hospital bhubneswar
Review: This is the worst thing about studying medicine in semi-government or private medical colleges in India. The fees are very high like 10 times the fees students pay in government colleges. The total fees will be around 40lakhs for complete mbbs in Hitech Bhubaneswar and there is no concession or reduction of fees for any students. You can apply for specific scholarships in the national scholarship portal but these are very less as compared to the fees of the college. Name: Sejal
Heading: Techno - The Best

A maximum of the subject's books and journals are available in the library.
It has well-maintained classrooms and each year, at least two times sports events take place in our college and many other events like quiz events, art competitions, robotics, etc.
Many clubs are run by students and faculty in this college like art club, dance club, sports club, photography club, movie club, etc.

Name: Anubhav
Heading: MNIT Review
Review:
I choose this course because I love electronics, and the faculty is very good they offer dsa course also in the course curriculum which helps in getting placement in tech companies. Midterms are held in 1 and half months and end term 4 months. exams are not difficult in 1st year after it becomes a little bit tough.
Most of the faculties are from top IITs and foreign universities.

Name: Radhika Gupta
Heading: Mnit not for girls

Name: Khushal Pabri
Heading: Insides from DTU
Review: DTU has three festivals, beginning in the final week of January and running until the end of February. DTU's Literary Festival, Tech Fest, and Cultural Festival are among the finest planned in the country. Anyone is welcome to join the college's technical and non-technical societies. These societies serve to increase your general confidence while also developing your personality and expertise. DTU has various societies, including Pratibimb, NSS, Ecell, IEEE, IET, and many more. There is a very big cricket ground, an indoor sports room with badminton courts and table tennis, a basketball court, a gymnasium, a rugby field, and a gym on campus for encouraging sports activities among students. There is also a very big library with a lot of academic books which you can issue and take home for a specific period of time. There are also books for higher studies in the research section of the library.

Name: CHANDRAMANI KUMAR PATEL
Heading: Should you join DTU or not
Review:
I took Civil Engineering out of my passion or it's like my dad is a Civil Engineer too so it's like to follow in his footsteps of him.
About the faculty-to-student ratio is quite good, there are enough teachers for every class.
Many teachers here are very educated even some have been educated at foreign Universities and other from prestige Indian Universities.
But the teaching is a bit dizzy like professors send their PHD students to take classes sometimes but other than that all is fine
About Examinations we have 2 Exams for every semester one is called Mid Sem and the other is End Sem
Usually, for even semester, it happens during Feb-mid Sem and May - end sem
And for the odd semesters, it happens during Sep- mid sem and nov- end sem.

Name: Raviraj Singh
Heading: Truth of amity

Name: Shubham Kumar

this college provides the internship like a summer internship with a generous stipend.
the previous past year many students were shortlisted for big company internships to develop their skills to earn a huge amount stipend

College: University Institute of Engineering and Technology, Maharshi Dayanand University - [UIET]
Heading: My college

Name: Subodh Tamboli
College: Changu Kana Thakur Arts, Commerce and Science College - [CKT]

Name: Aniket Kumar Sharma
College: University Institute of Engineering and Technology, Maharshi Dayanand University - [UIET]
Heading: Companies Offering in UIET MDU Campus Placement Drive

Zonal Youth Fest in the Month of December, Sports Events conducted in December.

Name: Nainika Baidya

College: MNNIT Allahabad - Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology - [MNNIT]
Heading: My MNNIT
Review:

 Around 300 company visit per year to recruit students some of them are Microsoft Google Amazon uber Atlassian acressuim

 I will definitely go for a good placement after my degree

Name: Shivam
Heading: Okay

Name: Ketan Singh
College: Chitkara Institute of Engineering and Technology - [CIET]
Heading: Chitkara University normal review
Review:
There is no fee hike for 4 years once you opt for a course, only the hostel fee is increased by about 5% every sem otherwise everything is good here
I didn't get any scholarship, but if you talk about placement, placement is good, and the rest depends on you

Name: Kartik sharma
Heading: About DTU
Review: College placement starts in the 7th semester. A lot of big tech companies like Google, Microsoft etc visit the campus. many non-tech companies like sprinklers etc also visit the campus. Overall around 60% of students get placed, in civil engineering, only around 30-40% were placed.

Name: Aswin kumar
Heading: with good reputation among parent's

There are many clubs also available and NSS and NCC are also available.

Name: Joydev maity
Heading: A NICE JOURNEY OF CGEC

Our college approved one scholarship like SVMCM, OASIS etc. If you belong to a poor family then you can be allocated as a student then no need to give semester fees.

Name: Gopi chandh
Heading: College with good placements
Review: The college faculty is well trained in their respective subjects. The college has a good student and faculty ratio. The qualification of teachers is assistant professor and professors. The college conduct exams semester-wise as it is an autonomous college the paper is tough to attempt.

Name: Manoj Yadav
Heading: Best College C.V. Raman
Review: The placement cell of this college is very active and they provide placement training before the actual placement. The highest package in 2020 is 28 Lacs given to a Computer Science student. Every year min 70%-80% of students get their placements.

Name: SAMEER CHAURASIA
College: Dr BR Ambedkar National Institute of Technology - [NIT]
Heading: All about my college

Name: Pavan
Heading: LIFE AT IIT DUNDIGAL

Name: SUMEET KUMAR
College: Chitkara Institute of Engineering and Technology - [CIET]
Heading: Review of Chitkara University, Rajpura, Punjab
Review:
From the 5th semester, students become eligible for college internships and from the 6th semester for college placements.

Name: Sanket
Heading: Best placements

I belong to obc so I have to pay only 50 % of the tution fee I pay 97000 and the rest of the fee is paid by gov of Maharashtra to the college

the exam is taken by the csvtu board and exam centers are allocated for each student in each semester.

Heading: Its all about my college and nothing else needs to be added.

Name: Nikhil
Heading: Think career Think Malla Reddy

Name: SHUBHAM RAJ
College: IIT BHU - Indian Institute of Technology
Heading: INTERNSHIP

Name: NEER GARG
Heading: B. TECH ( CSE )

Name: MOHIT
College: Pt Bhagwat Dayal Sharma Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences - [PGIMS]
Heading: Pgims rohtak reality check
Review: I chose the course because I did not get selected for M.B.B.S. Initially I was not happy with this course but with time i found my happiness in the course. The course curriculum was pretty simple. There are 4 subjects in first-year anatomy, dental anatomy, biochemistry, and physiology. There are total 3 exams for the first year one common for biochemistry and physio and 2 others in 2nd year the main subjects are pathology microbiology pharma and dental materials but there are practical papers for 2 subjects of the final year are operative dentistry and prosthodontics they take 3 theory exams and 2 practical exams practical exams are for pre-clinical work of prostho and operative 3 subjects in 3rd year and 8 subjects in final year faculty members are okay some are good some are not they don't focus on sports activities.

Name: Student (Anonymous)

Name: KUNTAL GORAI
Heading: STRESSFUL COLLEGE WITH A LOT OF EXCITMENT.
Review:
Life on campus is good. There are various circular activities like hackathons, quiz maina etc. It will be more fun if you are at our campus (they have lot more events than ec campus). We have an annual fest held during the month of October-November.
There are a sufficient number of books at the library for reference and you get access to the digital library (containing books, research papers, and previous years' qps for every course) if you are a PES university student.
Every classroom had a large tv to project slides presented by the professor and large blackboards. It has also sufficient benches (three students per bench can suffice the entire strength of the classroom). It has many cupboards for you to keep some extra accessories (not your college bags).
There are a lot of sports activities going on every semester like table tennis, cricket(a large cricket ground), football, volleyball, badminton court etc.
There are a lot of social groups run by students you can check the pes university link for more details.

Name: Wali haider
Heading: My opinion
Review: The admission process is quite complicated but not lengthy. There are three types of modes of admission in this college. The first one is through JEE mains score cutoff which is around 89 percentile or around 80000 ranks for Computer Science and Engineering Branch. The second one is through management quota but the admission fee is a bit more as compared to the previous one. The last mode is through the merit-based selection which is based on class 12th percentage or marks. You can find the application form of this college on their official website or through AKTU counseling. The application fee is 1000 approximately. The date of the application form is released after Jee Main's result.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: CODE MFGC
Review:
The campus is not that liking but it's nice how it is.
In the center of the college, there is an assembly ground known as Quadrangle its so nice and beautiful there we assemble weekly assembly on SAT and give rewards to those who made achievements like in sports, study, NCC, etc.
The library is the best thing in this college there is every book on your syllabus and some reading books, you could take any books you like by making a library card and you have to return them in the period they are given.
Sports there is every sport which you wanna join you can join and practice (ex. Chess, TT, cricket, etc)
Also, there is NCC.
There is a volunteer group known as VOMC which is for maintaining any crowd situations, also they have been volunteers for other colleges too.

Name: Vikanshi
Heading: Internship
Review: The infrastructure of clubs and organizations is better in many ways. Groups like Google and geeks for geeks student chapters are also present here and work actively. So in short if you are really interested in something LPU will help you in achieving it with its own benefits obviously but if are here to just enjoy college life and without any future aim then LPU will motivate you to enjoy the campus life ;)

Name: Chandra prakash sharma
Heading: Jhalawar medical college.... A good choice

Annual fest -axons, cultural programs, sports week.

Students welfare society group is there for restrictions of ragging-like activities.

Name: Anwar khan
College: Pt Bhagwat Dayal Sharma Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences - [PGIMS]
Heading: Pgims is heaven for doctors
Review:
I choose this course because I really wanna serve people by providing them with good health care.
There are 250 students in my batch and around 10-15 professors for every subject.
All the faculty members are MBBS MDs and super specialists. The teaching method is basically theory classes in lecture theater then practicals and postings in various departments.
Term exams take around 1 month and are easy to pass.

Name: Rohit
Heading: Drive to future
Review:
There is every year tech fest conduct. In the first year, the fresher party was organized by our seniors in august and after that, in December the annual function was organized. Every December tech fest was organized. There is a large library where we can get books for study for 15 days after that we have to submit these books and can take other books or can retake the books.
There are extracurricular activities like sports dance etc. The sports lecture is on Tuesday and Saturday. And sports programs are also organized by the college.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Shaheed Hasan Khan Mewati Government Medical College - [SHKM] Nalhar
Heading: Mbbs life
Review: Term exam occured 3 times in a year . Necessary to pass these exams . If u study regularly then it is very easy but on studying at last time it is very difficult to pass. Syllabus of mbbs is too vast so to read at last time is very difficult.

Name: Suchita
College: Pt Bhagwat Dayal Sharma Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences - [PGIMS]
Heading: Nice college and course
Review: I have always wanted to become a doctor that's why I choose this course I got a good rank so I qualified to be a doctor in one of the government medical Colleges. There are a lot of departments and because post-graduation is also there in pgims Rohtak, this creates a good teacher-to-student ratio. The best thing about the teaching method is clinical rotations which change monthly.

Name: Nadeem Ahmed Khan
College: Pt Bhagwat Dayal Sharma Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences - [PGIMS]
Heading: Your point fir success PGIMS

There are criteria for scholarship 
NSP and Haryana har chatrvite is there in college

College: Silver Oak College of Engineering and Technology - [SOCET]

There are many libraries on the college campus. You can go and read the books in the library. Also, you can take the books home. But you must pay around rs 5 - 10 per book for per day.
The college is held many activities like sports, social activities, etc.
You can find the social media profile of the college on Instagram, Facebook, etc. And you can contact them.

Name: Pinninti Kiran sai
College: Aditya Institute of Technology and Management -[AITAM] Tekkali
Heading: College review : sweet and sour
Review: The fee structure is quite good when compared to other colleges. We have to pay a total of 80000 for the two semesters with an additional amount of 10000 to be paid as a building fund. We have to pay 40000 in the first semester and another 40000 in another semester. And during semester exams we need to pay 1600 as term exam fees. But the term fees need to be paid before the start of the term exam. They used to be strict on this matter. And coming to the scholarships in Andhra Pradesh most of the people get Vidyadevana which means they need not pay a single penny except the bus fees. But for lads whose parents are working in the government sector or taxpayers, they need to pay the complete fees. The bus fees of the college differ based on the areas the bus travel to. For army brats, there will be a scholarship called pass through which we will get 30000 every year. I have been placed in the MNC called CAPGEMINI through placements

Sports is also given major attention as we have fest for sports and regular intercollege competitions. The college has clubs like Arts club which helps the students devolup a proper environment and brings the creator in them out and it also conducts many fests in the college through the year

Techi of the year is the tech fest conducted by Modal club in December
DJ night is the annual fest.
Here in a library you will be available with all the academic books till the last year and more books on ecology etc. you will be provided with a library card from which you can issue a book for 14 days and then you have to return it else you will be fined.

Name: Jyothish Datha
Heading: A perfect combination of study with enjoyment. ITM University Gwalior
Review: Students become eligible for campus placement after they enter the 5th semester. Many companies came here for placement like Amazon, Microsoft, Infosys, Wipro, Nagaro, Capgemini, byjus, and many more. The average package offered by the company is 5.5 LPA. Packages start from 3LPA and the maximum package got by a B. Tech student is 45LPA in Microsoft. And if I talk about the percentage of a student getting placement 90% of students got placed on the campus. I completed my bachelor's here and now pursuing a master's after my master's I'll apply for companies coming in colleges.

College: Pt Bhagwat Dayal Sharma Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences - [PGIMS]

Name: Archana A S
Heading: A brief of everything you need to know about B. Arch in TKM college of Engineering, Kollam
Review:
The annual tech fest conducted in our college - HESTIA is widely known in south India with numerous workshops, tech shows, band events, and talks involving famous personalities from all over India. It usually happens in an even semester in the month of May.
Apart from that, there are sub-events like CRESCITA conducted for technical events, and LOVE LOCKS on valentines day in which we visit orphanages, hair donation camps, and other activities happen.
We have an extensive library with workspace just near the campus with an area of 930 sq.m. It contains a total of 9346 books and 15112 e-journals and other learning resources and is open to all from 9 am to 9 pm.
The classrooms that have been built way back have been maintained to an optimum standard with adequate ventilation and wooden benches and chairs and smart class facilities still some classrooms remain dingy and accumulate dust
The sports events are also a highlight of the college with extensive football grounds and other facilities.

There are different clubs and societies in college and I suggest you join.

College: University College of Engineering Narasaraopet, JNTUK

The college canteen has very good quality food. In college, there is a sports room where many sports are played like table tennis, chess, etc. and there is also a very big playground for playing outdoor games.

Name: Srikanth
College: National Institute of Electronics and Information Technology - [NIELIT]

After the fifth semester you anyway need to do the project and also you will get industrial exposure. You can apply for the internships and can finish them as you wish.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: So Good!!
Review: the fee structure for JSSATEB is different for different sets of students. students who are from outside Karnataka and Hyderabad came through the COMEDK exam and the fee structure for that is around Rs 2,40,000/- per year. for Karnataka-Hyderabad students who came through the KCET exam, it is Rs 95000/- per year and for management students, it is around Rs 500000/- extra overall after your college fees payment. coming to placements, the placements here are average. you'll easily get placed at 5 lacs to 6 lacs but there are certain rules on placement activities that will refrain you to get higher placements even if you're a brilliant student. one you get placed at some package then you can only sit for exams that are double the CTC offered to you so once you get paced at 5 lacs or 6 lacs you can't sit for 10 or 12 lacs and there are very less company here that come for that high packages. the internship opportunities from college are almost null. you have to get it yourself off campus.

Name: Ishank Agarwal
Heading: One of the best University in Jaipur
Review: I chose this course because it was recommended to me by the school's principal and then when I look into the curriculum of the course I got really impressed because they have a very diverse and innovative curriculum. JKLU USP is their faculty they have one of the finest and very qualified faculty among any college in Jaipur. The student ratio is not very impressive in the university it's roughly around 80:20. Faculty of JKLU is one of the best things about this university they have one of the most qualified faculty in Jaipur 90% of our professors have Masters and Ph.D. degrees from Tier-1 colleges like IIM and IIT. So naturally, their teaching methods are one of the finest and very inclusive, and two ways you will not feel lethargic or bored during lectures. are 2 exams in one semester one is the mid-term exam and the second is the final term exam. you can pass them easily by doing group studies and by preparing proper notes in lectures.

Name: Hitesh parmar
Heading: Nitpatna review
Review: The college campus is nice and beautiful. You will get the vibe of old is gold. The college campus is fully residential but if you are from Patna, Bihar then less chance of you getting hostels. Brahmaputra, Kosi, and Soan are boys' hostels while Ganga is a girls' hostel. The library is well-equipped with Wi-Fi facilities all over the campus. Labs are well-built and fully equipped. Mess food is far better than most NITs. Medical insurance is provided for college students. Dhyan hand stadium is there.
